Transcript: Billy: Reva?

Reva: I'm still here. You were supposed to wake me up. Oh, Billy, look at the 
time.
Billy: Hey, don't worry about it. You can wash my car later. Bad day?
Reva: It feels like it might be.
Billy: Well then, you just lay here and you rest.

Reva: No, no, no, no, just give me a few minutes to get it together. I'll be 
fine. ( Knock on door )

Cassie: Billy, hi. I'm sorry to bother you. It's kind of weird even just 
being here, but I didn't know where else to go.
Billy: What's wrong?
Cassie: It's Josh. He's missing.

Josh: Reva Shayne Lewis... Lewis... Lewis! You come slamming in and out of my 
life whenever you damn well please. First you make me want you more and then you 
push me towards your sister. Cassie Winslow. Cassie Winslow. I understand your 
scared. I get it. It get it, Cassie, but we've come too far for you to turn back 
now. You've got to stop flip- flopping. You've got to stop flip- flopping. 
You've got to stop flip- flopping.
Coop: Ava?
Ava: Present. Sorry, I didn't mean to wake you up.

Coop: No, please, the sound of computer keys in the morning, I love it. 
What's that, Spaulding business?

Ava: No. I woke up this morning and I've been thinking about my mom, so I 
thought maybe I'd try to organize some of my thoughts.
Coop: You're writing her a letter?

Ava: Must have gotten that from you. Yeah, you know, I thought maybe it could 
bring me some clarity, some....
Coop: About Olivia?
Ava: Being a good mother was more important than anything to my mom.
Coop: Except you're not Emma’s mother.

Ava: I know that. But if I testify against Olivia and she goes to jail, I'm 
taking Emma’s mother away from her. Little girls need to be protected.
Coop: So do big girls, too.
Ava: Coop...

Coop: Look, Ava, I get that you want Emma to be safe and happy. All right, so 
do I, but did you ever think that perhaps Olivia is a bigger threat to Emma than 
she really is to you? I mean, wouldn't it be safer and easier to protect Emma if 
Olivia wasn't in her life? Maybe sending Olivia to jail might be the best gift 
that you can give that little girl.
Olivia: Thanks for the ride, Officer Gorilla.
Frank: Thank you, Officer. Tell your chief I owe him one.
Cop: Will do.
Olivia: What the hell was going on?
Frank: Were you able to drop Emma off at the babysitter's?

Olivia: Yeah, Officer Meathead let me drop her off, but he didn't say why he 
brought me here. Am I under arrest?

Frank: No, not yet. Olivia, I'm going to do everything in my power to protect 
you, but you have to answer some questions for me.
Olivia: Questions?

Frank: I overheard Ava tell Coop that you tried to run her over in your car. 
She said you looked her right in the eye and you stepped on the gas.
Olivia: That... that's insane.

Frank: I know this isn't news for you, but she also told me that she told you 
she was to press charges against you once Emma got better. So what did you do 
once she was released? You left town.
Olivia: On vacation.

Frank: You know, Olivia, if it turns out that you did indeed try to hurt Ava, 
and you ran away, you're going to be in a whole lot more trouble than I could 
possible get you out of.
Buzz: She's in there, isn't she, Frank? The sitter called me.
Frank: Look, we haven't charged her with anything yet.
Buzz: You tapped my phone?
Frank: Look, Pop, I overheard your conversation with her, okay?

Buzz: So you followed me, that's how you got the number? It was a private 
conversation, Frank.

Frank: Ava honestly believes that Olivia tried to run her over. I had to look 
into it.
Buzz: And run around my back in the process, right?

Frank: So if I could have just come out and asked you for the number, you 
would have given it to me, Pop?
Buzz: I want to see her, Frank.
Frank: That's not a good idea.

Buzz: Well, unless it's against the law. Is she under arrest, Frank. Is it an 
official arrest?
Frank: No, not yet.

Buzz: Then open the door. Open the door, Frank, or I'll make it ugly. I mean 
lawyers, everything. I mean it. Hi.
Olivia: Hey. I'm so glad to see you.

Buzz: Well, you might not feel that way for long, because I'm going to ask 
you a lot of the same things he asked you. Let's start with the most obvious 
question. Did you try to run Ava down?

Coop: Ava, look, I do not mean to make things harder for you than they 
already are.

Ava: I know, I know. Okay? I'm just confused. Hearing you talk about toxic 
Olivia and Emma... and the truth of the matter is I'm the only person who's hurt 
that child until now.

Coop: No, no, it's not you, okay? That was an accident, but what Olivia tried 
to do to you the other night, that was not. You know that.
Ava: Yeah, I do. I know.

Coop: Ava, look, I don't know what your mom would tell you to do about 
Olivia, okay? I can't begin to guess, but what I think she would say about you 
yourself is that you need to give yourself a little bit of a break.

Ava: Do you know what she used to say to me sometimes? She would call me 
Wendy worry.
Coop: Wendy worry?

Ava: And she would kiss me in the middle of my forehead and she would say, 
"Come on, Ava, lighten up."

Coop: Lighten up? Okay. I guess I should probably keep that in mind, then, 
for next time, huh?
Ava: Maybe you should.
Coop: Maybe I should. Maybe I will.
Ava: You should.

Coop: Okay. When Emma was in the hospital, all right, Olivia was not the only 
person who was worried sick and a wreck about the situation. Ava, you were too. 
But you know what? Emma is better, so you've got to let this go, please.
Ava: I don't know if I can let it go, that's the thing about...
Coop: Stop, stop.
Ava: She's in the my face all the time.

Coop: I understand that, stop. You're working yourself up, okay? Don’t. You 
don't have to make a decision right now. There's no need to. I'm not asking you 
to. What I'm just asking you to do is to take a breath and relax. Take a step 
back.

Ava: You're right. You're right, you're right. Now that Emma’s out of the 
hospital, I've got to let go, right?
Coop: Yes, you do, yeah. You know what?
Ava: What?
Coop: I'm pretty good at helping people let go.
Ava: Oh, yeah?
Coop: Uh-huh. Hey, psst.
Ava: What?
Coop: Over here, Wendy worry.
Billy: When was the last time that you saw him?

Cassie: He's not at home, he's not answering his phone, he's not returning 
messages.
Billy: Did you try him at work? Sometimes he get buried down there.

Cassie: No, he's not there. All Wanda would tell me is that he's on a short 
leave. Short leave to another planet, maybe, I don't know. But I was just hoping 
that you would know something.

Billy: Hey, I'm about the last person... he and I aren't exactly great 
friends right now.
Cassie: I know, I know. I was just hoping you'd know.
Billy: I'm sorry.

Reva: Maybe I can help. Come on in, Cassie. Didn't you have a meeting that 
you had to go to or something?
Billy: Yeah, exactly. Okay, good luck.
Cassie: Well, I didn't realize you were here.
Reva: Well, you didn't ask.

Cassie: I just figured that Billy was more likely to be in touch with Josh 
and I didn't want to pull you into it.
Reva: Cassie, we're still sisters. If you need help, you can come to....
Cassie: This isn't just help, Reva. It's Josh.

Gillespie: Ms. Spencer, sorry to keep leaving messages but about that young 
lady you got a problem with, I haven't heard nothing from you, so I'm still 
guessing I got your green light to make that problem go away. All I got to do is 
find the girl and that shouldn't take too long. I'll be in touch. Morning. Can I 
get a coffee, please? Black.
Ashlee: Sure.

Gillespie: There's a pretty young lady who used to work here. I think her 
names begins with an "A." Is she still around.
Ashlee: Well, my name begins with an "A." It's Ashlee.
Gillespie: The pretty young lady I'm talking about has dark hair.
Ashlee: Oh you must mean Ava.
Gillespie: That's it, Ava.

Ashlee: Yeah, she's the pretty young girl everyone is talking about. She was 
supposed to work shifts but then some crisis came up, and who had to fill in for 
her but me, of course. She's gorgeous. Legs up to here, don't even get me 
started on her... never mind, you don't need to hear all this junk.
Gillespie: No, Ashlee, I'm happy to listen to anything you have to tell me.

Billy: Hey, you keep pounding like that you're going to have that framed up 
by dinner time.

Josh: What the hell are you doing here? Well, you remember when you were 
about 15....
Josh: Oh, God.

Billy: Hey, H.P. chewed you out for taking his Cadillac, going over to see 
Reva and you went off to the woods, built yourself a shed. You were mad, you 
were pounding, so I picked all the Lewis sites and I figured I would just wait 
until I heard you pounding.
Josh: All right, all right. Who sent you here? Was it Cassie or was it Reva?
Billy: Nobody sends me anywhere.

Josh: Yeah, right. And just for the record, I am not angry. I am confused. I 
am frustrated beyond belief but I am not angry.
Billy: Yeah, well, obviously I couldn't mistake that.
Josh: What are you doing?

Billy: I'm going to take out some of my frustrations, put hinges on this door 
so I can shut you out.

Josh: Have you ever wondered what it would have been like if we had never had 
any Shayne’s come into our lives?
Billy: It would have been a lot more boring.

Josh: Yeah, but you know what? It might have been more sane, too, because 
these sisters, these two incredible sisters, these beautiful, strong-willed, 
incredibly capable sisters have now succeeded in driving me completely and 
utterly insane.

Billy: You know something? I think you might just be a little responsible for 
that because you love them both.
( Knock on door )
Ava: Ow, damn it. It's probably one of Olivia’s slavettes trying to...
Coop: Well, I got two words for those slavettes, get lost!
Ava: You know what? I'll get it. It works for me. I'm cool, all right? What?
Alan-Michael: I need you.
Ava: Excuse me?

Alan-Michael: A major emergency cropped overnight at Spaulding. P.R., stock 
prices, the whole nine yards. You've got to come in right now.
Coop: Please, why don't you come right in. Your phone not working?
Alan-Michael: I called. I got... it was voice mail.
Ava: I had a bit of a rough night. I turned my phone off.
Alan-Michael: I know how that is.
Coop: You can wait down in the lobby, you know.
Alan-Michael: No, I'm good, thanks.
Coop: So, what was that huge emergency brought you over here, huh?

Alan-Michael: Foreign subsidiary blew a project deadline. I need Ava to come 
in and pull together a ton of damage control info while I do triage on the 
phones.
Coop: Making the world safe one buck at a time, huh?
Ava: Okay, all right, you know what? I'm done, bye. I'll call you later.
Coop: Yeah.
Alan-Michael: Coop.

Olivia: Wow, so what did Frank deputize you? You guys are going to do some 
father/son, good cop/bad cop thing on me?
Buzz: No, I just want to know what happened.

Olivia: What happened? Okay, I'll tell you what happened. I was set up by 
Ava. She just happened to be jabbering about this heinous thing that I 
supposedly did at the very moment that Frank hears what's going on... I mean, 
come on, she's trying to ruin my life.

Buzz: I don't care what Ava did or did not do. I'm here about you. So, tell 
me yes or no. Did you deliberately step on the gas when you saw Ava in front of 
your car?

Olivia: I don't really understand what happened. I... I hadn't slept in days. 
I was drinking, I was exhausted and fuzzy and then all of a sudden she was 
standing there, the very woman who tried to destroy my life.

Buzz: You could have killed her. My son loves her. What if you had killed 
her? And then the voices inside of you would have been quieted? Your sense of 
justice would've been satisfied?

Olivia: No, no, but I didn’t. I didn't kill her. All I can say is that I 
wasn't in my right mind that night.
Buzz: So, we're all supposed to pretend that it didn't happen?
Olivia: No, all I'm asking is that you try and understand.

Buzz: I'll be 100% straight with you. I love you, still love you. Won't judge 
you. But you need help and I don't think I'm the one to give it to you.

Young Olivia: Serves you right. What did mother always tell us? The only 
person you can count on is yourself.

Billy: As I recollect, you were rushing off to get Reva to sign those divorce 
papers so you could get back to Cassie.
Josh: You know what, Billy? Don't worry about it.

Billy: Worry? Yeah, yeah. I know that you think I'm going to try to win Reva 
back and all of that.
Billy: Not really.
Josh: Well, that's good, because it's over. It's finished.
Billy: Yeah, I know.

Josh: I still don't know why it is that she took off all those months ago but 
it really doesn't matter, does it?
Billy: No, I guess it really doesn’t.

Josh: I know that there's always going to be a part of me that loves her and 
a part of her that loves me and that's why she dragged her feet a while back 
when she was supposed to be signing divorce papers, but you know what? That's 
okay. That I understand. It just happens to drive me crazy.
Billy: So tell me, how does Cassie make you feel?
Josh: Wonderful, most of the time.
Billy: And the rest of the time?

Josh: The rest of the time... well, let me see. Let me put it this way, all 
right? Our relationship would be perfect if it weren't for the fact that that 
she's Reva’s sister, or if we lived in some kind of a bubble somewhere-- that 
would be good-- but that's not really reality, is it? So every time there's even 
a mention of me and Reva, Cassie panics and she runs away.
Billy: You really can't blame her for being skittish now, can you?

Josh: No, no, I don't blame her at all, but it just makes me a little bit 
crazy, too. So I got both sisters giving me like a double dose of crazy all the 
time, 24/7, which is exactly why I came here, Billy, so I could try to just get 
rid of all of that, get it all out of my system, you know?
Billy: You know, maybe if...
Josh: So why don't we stop talking and work?
Billy: Okay.
Josh: Thank you.
Reva: We're not competing for Josh.

Cassie: Maybe not, but pretending that it isn't a huge deal for me to date 
him isn't going to get us anywhere.
Reva: Well, like I said, I'm okay with it. I have a new address.

Cassie: So I notice. I get it, you're with Billy now and that doesn't change 
the fact that Josh has been the love of your life.
Reva: Well, life changes and I'm not the woman I used to be.

Cassie: Reva, I appreciate you trying to keep the peace in this family, but I 
got to tell you, to me, it kind of seems forced, almost faked, actually. I'm 
sorry, but that's just the truth.

Reva: I know that it does seem like a strange situation for everyone 
involved, but, you know, I've been around long enough to know that in this world 
anything is possible, and if I say that it's okay if you and Josh to be together 
I'm sure that's strange coming out of my mouth, but...
Cassie: Yeah, that's strange. Never thought I'd hear that.

Reva: Well, you know, life throws you curveballs and I've learned you have to 
go with the pitches. Might as well, because what is, is, and you can't fight it.

Cassie: But Reva, you have fought for everything you've ever wanted in your 
life. Are you telling me you're just going to give up on this suddenly?

Reva: No, I'm just getting smarter now. And you know, I'm with Billy and it's 
okay if you and Josh are together.

Cassie: You make it sound as if it's as easy as swapping place cards at the 
Lewis Christmas dinner. It isn’t. Look at how awkward it is for us just to be in 
the same room together.
Reva: These changes are going to be odd for all of us, but I don't care.

Cassie: But why... why not, Reva? That's the part I'm really having a hard 
time understanding here.

Reva: Because, Cassie, it's just... there's no time to waste, okay? I mean, 
there's just...
Jordan Clark, "Inside The Light."

I mean, I remember sitting in a car with Robert Newman, and we were kind of 
recounting something-- and I don't even remember what it was-- but I remember we 
just both kind of sighed at the same time. And, you know, and he was sighing 
like, "I'm this way" and I'm sighing like, "I'm that way" and it happened, and I 
thought, "I don't have any brothers, but this guy could definitely be my 
brother."
See Billy Wednesday, September 27, "Inside The Light."
Olivia: I'm not the same person I was when I was you. I can trust Buzz.
Young Olivia: Wow, after all of these years, still kidding yourself.
Olivia: He understands me.

Young Olivia: Didn't you just hear what he just said? “What if you had killed 
her, the woman that my son loves?”
Olivia: Because he was worried about how bad things would get for me.

Young Olivia: Read between the lines. It was the guy's he was telling you his 
family will always come before you.
Olivia: I am a part of Buzz's family.

Young Olivia: Get a grip. What man has ever taken you before his family? 
Richard, Josh, Phillip, Bill Lewis? None of them. Men do one thing. Two, if you 
count jumping our bones. They cause pain, that's their specialty.
Olivia: Leave me alone.

Young Olivia: The only person in this world you can trust is the one staring 
right back at you when I know you look in the mirror. And even you're not too 
dependable these days.
Olivia: Well, a lecture and an insult. Terrific.

Young Olivia: Well, what were you thinking trying to track down this baby? We 
gave her away.
Olivia: I was thinking of the child I still have, Emma.
Young Olivia: What?

Olivia: Emma woke from her coma. She said she had another sister visit her. 
It wasn't Lizzie. I took it as a sign.
Young Olivia: To do something really stupid?
Olivia: That I should find my first daughter.

Young Olivia: Right, who would only remind us of the pain and misery we had 
to go through. What a reunion that would be.

Olivia: No, no, it could have been wonderful. It could have been warm and 
loving...

Young Olivia: You're dreaming. The day we saw that baby carried out of the 
hospital, we made a promise we would never think about her again.
Olivia: Stop it.

Young Olivia: We swore that we'd get her out of our minds, out of our memory, 
for good. Because all she'd ever do is bring back the pain we went through.
Olivia: Things change, time has gone by.

Young Olivia: Not enough. There'll never be enough. Open your eyes. Look 
around. Don't you think there's more important things to deal with here and now? 
Rather than bringing back your worst memory back to life?
Ava: Must not be too much of an emergency if we have time for brunch.
Alan-Michael: There's no emergency at Spaulding, Ava.
Ava: Well, then why did you come to my room then, huh? Oh.

Alan-Michael: Stop, I didn't do it to get you out of the sack with Coop. I 
did it to help you with this thing with Olivia.
Ava: And how did you know about that?
Alan-Michael: I hear things. I have people and places.
Ava: Of course you do.

Alan-Michael: And the second I heard that Olivia had skipped town and the 
Springfield P.D. had to get a Chicago cop to bring her back...
Ava: Wait a minute. Olivia left town?
Alan-Michael: Yeah, with Emma.
Ava: And she was arrested and then they brought her back?

Alan-Michael: Just brought back for questioning. No charges. This is news to 
you?
Ava: Yeah, it's news to me.

Alan-Michael: I'm surprised, considering how connected you are to the 
Cooper’s. Well, maybe if Frank and Harley told Coop it would have broken some 
kind of police code of ethics, which is reason enough not to fill you in, 
considering that bunch, but I pay my man inside the police department enough 
that he has no ethical problems keeping me well informed. So you are interested 
in my help?
Cassie: Reva, what's wrong? Are you okay?
Reva: Yeah, you know, I did something to my back last night.
Cassie: Have a seat.

Reva: Sit... would be good. Probably going to be much better. That is much 
better.
Cassie: What did you mean by saying that there's no time to waste?

Reva: You know me. I'm nothing but a series of clichés. Seize the day. Live 
each day like it's your last. You know, that's me. Excuse me. Oh, I have to take 
this.
Cassie: Sure.
Reva: I'll be back. Billy?
Billy: Hi, sweetie, I'm just checking in.
Reva: Where are you? And what's the pounding?
Billy: That is Josh. He is working with a hammer.
Reva: You found him?
Billy: Well, I kind of knew where to look. Look, is Cassie still there?

Reva: Yeah, I'm putting on a happy face playing matchmaker. It's really a lot 
of fun.

Billy: Well, if you want to give this all up and come forward and tell the 
truth, tell them about your disease, we can figure it out from there, you know.

Reva: I've already got it figured out. They're going to need each other once 
I'm gone, them and the kids. It's just hard, Billy, it's just really hard.

Billy: Well, you know I hate to add to your misery here, but Josh kind of let 
me know that he is swearing off women altogether for right now.
Reva: Well, it's hard to be noble for a couple of stupid idiots.
Billy: You can say that again.
Reva: Where are you? How far away?
Billy: About half an hour.

Reva: There's a couple of other things I need you to do for me, if you don't 
mind. See if you can get your hands on Josh's cell phone and send a text message 
from it.

Billy: And the second thing? Oh come on, I can't do that. Reva, you're 
shameless. You know I'm hopelessly in love with you and you're taking advantage 
of it, I swear.
Cassie: Who was that?
Reva: A friend.
Cassie: Reva, what's going on?
Reva: Nothing.

Cassie: You say you want everything to be okay between us, but you're not 
acting okay. You're acting weird.
Reva: It's the kids.
Cassie: Marah and Shayne?

Reva: Yeah, Josh and I haven't decided exactly how to tell them that we've 
split again and we're running out of time because I think they're starting to 
get suspicious.

Cassie: Well, I think Marah is. I mean she kind of called me out of the blue, 
strangely, the other day and I think she had the feeling that something's up.
Reva: There you go.
Cassie: Let me just check this. It's a text message from Josh.
Reva: And?
Cassie: He wants me to meet him, like, now.
Reva: Then you should go.
Cassie: I'm sorry... I'm sorry, Reva.
Reva: Don't be sorry. Really, I mean at least we had a chance to talk.
Cassie: Yeah, we did. Okay. Well, be well, okay?
Reva: Being selfless sucks.
Olivia: Buzz?

Frank: No, it's me. You left this in the squad car. I thought you would like 
to check in with the sitter.
Olivia: Emma's at nursery school. Am I going to be here that long?

Frank: Yeah, it could be a while. Look, Olivia, I'm trying to do everything I 
can to keep this from escalating.
Olivia: Chief can't take sides.

Frank: No, not until I get all the facts. I'm going to be as fair as I 
possibly can, which also means I have to be fair to Ava.
Olivia: Thanks for the warning. Frank, Buzz isn't coming back, is he?
Frank: I really don't know.
Coop: Spencer. Not much here.
Buzz: Hey.
Coop: Pop.
Buzz: What are you hiding?
Coop: Nothing, nothing.

Buzz: Made a little nasty entry about Olivia in your journal? Maybe something 
for Springfieldburns.com, a little gossip?
Coop: Dad, look, I would never do something like that. Come on.

Buzz: I'm sorry, I was out of line. The way things are going, I can't promise 
it's not going to happen again.

Coop: Then what are we supposed to do? Are we supposed to totally avoid each 
other now?
Buzz: Could we do that?
Coop: Dad, I don't want to fight. I'm just trying to help, that's all.
Buzz: Help?
Coop: Yes, help.
Buzz: Help Olivia?

Coop: Help everyone. Look, Olivia’s actions have been-- I don't know, what 
would you call it-- over the top, perhaps?
Buzz: Over the top.

Coop: Listen, Olivia’s not evil, okay? But some of the things she does are, 
okay? Maybe if we could understand why she was doing them, maybe she has some 
dark secret, you might be able to help her get past it. And then we'd all be 
better off.

Alan-Michael: I realize the Cooper’s are the ones you turn to for help, but 
the way I see it, that family's the last one you should be taking advice from.
Ava: Why?
Alan-Michael: Because they're always being taken advantage of.
Ava: Are you kidding me? It's most of the time by your family.
Alan-Michael: Exactly.
Ava: Yeah.

Alan-Michael: Ava, you are a Spaulding employee now, which means that you're 
a member of our extended family, a family that's full of the sharpest lawyers in 
the country.
Ava: I don't need a lawyer. Olivia tried to run me down.

Alan-Michael: There's no witnesses, no proof. And you were the one 
babysitting Olivia’s kid once she drank the perfume and wound up in a coma.
Ava: That was an accident.

Alan-Michael: Ava, I am not judging you, but there are reams of documents up 
at Cedars attesting to Emma’s suffering because of that accident. So a ruthless 
lawyer-- and you know Olivia’s going to have one-- is going to use that. Not 
only could Olivia wind up not being indicted, but you could wind up faces 
criminal charges yourself. Look, we're all relieved that Emma’s made a full 
recovery.
Ava: Yeah, so am I.

Alan-Michael: But it wasn't luck that brought her out. It was the specialist 
that I had flown it in. It was my influence. That influence can help you, too.
Reva: Psst!
Billy: What are you doing out of bed?
Reva: I'm following through.

Billy: Look, you're about to screw this whole thing up if you don't get out 
of here. Josh could be here any second.
Reva: Well, good, then everything's on track and I'm okay with it.

Billy: Oh yes, sure you are. You're not cut out to play cupid, especially 
when it's Josh and Cassie that you're trying to hook up.
Reva: You're right. It kills me.
Billy: Yes.
Reva: Are you sure everything's set?
Billy: Yeah. Bribed the garage attendee, just waiting for Cassie, that's all.

Reva: The other love bird. She'll flutter in and they'll get stuck in the 
garage, just like they did the night of the blackout and then the rest, as they 
say, will be history.
Billy: Hey, look, let me take you back to the room, okay?
Reva: No.
Billy: You don't need to stay here and see this.

Reva: Billy, there's no way I'm going to leave until I know that this thing 
has worked. After all the trouble I've put into making sure it gets pulled off.
Billy: Reva, it’s....

Reva: No, Billy, just go. Meet me back at the Beacon, I'll be there. I just 
want to make sure mission is accomplished. Go.
Josh: What the hell are you doing?
Buzz: No great revelations here.
Coop: Nope.

Buzz: Thank you for letting me take a look. I'm glad you want a happy ending. 
I do too, you know?
Coop: Of course. You are the man in Olivia’s life.

Buzz: The man in Olivia Spencer’s life-- the one who's supposed to protect 
her to keep her safe? Oh jeez!
Coop: That's all I'm trying to do with Ava, too.
Buzz: But you still believe that Olivia wanted to hurt Ava.
Coop: Hurt... Dad, no, not hurt, Olivia tried to kill Ava.
Buzz: We've been through this!

Coop: Are you just going to stand there and tell me that I'm out of my mind, 
that Ava made up this whole entire story because she's not crazy about Olivia?
Buzz: No, I think Ava believes that Olivia wanted to hurt her.

Coop: That doesn't matter, Dad. What do you believe? Deep down, what do you 
believe?

Buzz: A week ago, I would have thought it was impossible for Olivia to want 
to kill someone, but....
Coop: And now?

Buzz: I don't know what to believe. Which makes me useless to you, to Ava. 
And Olivia.
Olivia: Well, thanks for bringing this to me.
Frank: No problem.

Olivia: I guess I should call Jane and tell her I'm not going to be picking

Frank: I'll let you get to it.
Olivia: Got a message.

Gillespie: Ms. Spencer, it's me. About your little problem, Ava Peralta. 
Since you didn't mention how loud you wanted me to take it with the young lady, 
I've got to assume we're talking ten, as in all the way. Just wanted to let you 
know I'm on her. She won't be bothering you anymore.

Olivia: That was yesterday. Frank! Frank! Chief Cooper, where is he? We have 
to find him.
Doris: Will the District Attorney do?
Olivia: What?
Doris: You seem a little upset, Ms. Spencer.
Olivia: How do you know my name?

Doris: I know your name because I'm probably going to be prosecuting you for 
attempted murder. Back in the room now, please. Look, we don't allow people of 
interest to wander around the place station without an escort. Did you hear me, 
Ms. Spencer?
Olivia: I don't want to kill anyone. I mean, I didn't try to kill anyone.

Doris: Great. We'll then enter a not guilty plea then. Not that it's going to 
help, because-- and this is off the record-- from what I've heard, if Ava 
Peralta is allowed to testify against you in court, you're going away for a 
long, long time.
Gillespie: This must be my lucky day. Going down?

Cassie: Well, this is where it all began, here, right, at the Greek Festival. 
Our first date.
Reva: You scared me.
Josh: Well, you were meeting somebody here, right?
Reva: Yeah, Billy is supposed to be meeting me.

Josh: Well, you must have missed him. You know, I was just with him a little 
while ago. He didn't say anything about a date with you.

Reva: Well, that's because we're together all time now, and I should get back 
to the Beacon, he's probably waiting.

Josh: Hold on for one second. If you were meeting Billy here, why were you 
hiding behind a pillar? Because, you know, that looked more like sneaking, to 
me, than meeting.
Reva: Don't be silly.
Josh: Did you know I was going to be here?
Reva: Oh, now, that is ridiculous. You know what? I'll just see you later.

Josh: No! No! I don't believe this. Nobody in the booth... the gates slammed 
shut. We're stuck here.
Reva: No kidding.

Doris: Once ms. Peralta signs a statement, all bets are off.
Gillespie: Your husband's just going to have to wait.
Josh Lewis is a one-woman guy.

Cassie: That one woman is me. Josh is free now. He is free to be with a woman
